meanings.def: at a point within an area or a space
examples: a country in Africa
The kids were playing in the street.
It's in that drawer.
I read about it in the paper.

meanings.def: within the shape of something; surrounded by something
examples: She was lying in bed.
sitting in an armchair
Leave the key in the lock.
Soak it in cold water.

meanings.def: into something
examples: He dipped his brush in the paint.
She got in her car and drove off.

meanings.def: forming the whole or part of something/somebody; contained within something/somebody
examples: There are 31 days in May.
all the paintings in the collection
I recognize his father in him (= his character is similar to his father's).

meanings.def: during a period of time
examples: in the 18th century
in spring/summer/autumn/winter
in the fall
in March
in the morning/afternoon/evening
I'm getting forgetful in my old age.

meanings.def: after a particular length of time
examples: to return in a few minutes/hours/days/months.
It will be ready in a week's time (= one week from now).
She learnt to drive in three weeks (= after three weeks she could drive).

meanings.def: for a particular period of time
examples: I haven't seen him in years.
It's the first letter I've had in ten days.

meanings.def: wearing something
examples: dressed in their best clothes
the man in the hat
to be in uniform
She was all in black.

meanings.def: used to describe something that is all around you
examples: We went out in the rain.
He was sitting alone in the darkness.

meanings.def: used to show the language, material, etc. used
examples: Say it in English.
She wrote in pencil.
Put it in writing.
I paid in cash.
He spoke in a loud voice.

meanings.def: used to show a state or condition
examples: I'm in love!
The house is in good repair.
I must put my affairs in order.
a man in his thirties
The daffodils were in full bloom.

meanings.def: involved in something; taking part in something
examples: to act in a play

meanings.def: used to show somebody’s job or profession
examples: He is in the army.
She's in computers.
in business

meanings.def: used to show the form, shape, arrangement or quantity of something
examples: a novel in three parts
Roll it up in a ball.
They sat in rows.
People flocked in their thousands to see her.

meanings.def: used to show the quality or thing that a judgement is being made about
examples: She was not lacking in courage.
a country rich in minerals
three metres in length

meanings.def: while doing something; while something is happening
examples: In attempting to save the child from drowning, she nearly lost her own life.
In all the commotion I forgot to tell him the news.

meanings.def: used to introduce the name of a person who has a particular quality
examples: We're losing a first-rate editor in Jen.

meanings.def: used to show a rate or relative amount
examples: a gradient of one in five
a tax rate of 22 pence in the pound

meanings.def: for the reason that; because
examples: She was fortunate in that she had friends to help her.
She was fortunate in that she had friends to help her.

meanings.def: into an object, an area or a substance
examples: She opened the door and went in.
The kids were playing by the river and one of them fell in.

meanings.def: contained within an object, an area or a substance
examples: We were locked in.
I can't drink coffee with milk in.

meanings.def: at home or at a place of work
examples: Nobody was in when we called.
I didn't hear you come in.

meanings.def: at the place where people can get on or off, for example the station
examples: The bus is due in (= it should arrive) at six.

meanings.def: received
examples: Applications must be in by April 30.

meanings.def: at or towards its highest point on land
examples: Is the tide coming in or going out?

meanings.def: elected
examples: Several new councillors got in at the last election.

meanings.def: if a team or team member is in, they are batting
if the ball is in, it has landed inside the line
examples: Her serve was just in.
The ball landed in.

meanings.def: to be present when something happens
examples: They were in at the start.

meanings.def: to be going to experience something soon, especially something unpleasant
examples: He's in for a shock!
I'm afraid we're in for a storm.

meanings.def: to be/become involved in something; to share or know about something
examples: I'd like to be in on the plan.
Is she in on the secret?

meanings.def: to be (very) friendly with somebody, and likely to get an advantage from the friendship
going regularly to a place
examples: He was in and out of jail for most of his life.

idioms.def: to be present when something happens
examples: They were in at the start.

idioms.def: to be going to experience something soon, especially something unpleasant
examples: He's in for a shock!
I'm afraid we're in for a storm.

idioms.def: to be/become involved in something; to share or know about something
examples: I'd like to be in on the plan.
Is she in on the secret?

idioms.def: to be (very) friendly with somebody, and likely to get an advantage from the friendship

examples: He was in and out of jail for most of his life.

meanings.def: popular and fashionable
examples: Purple is the in colour this spring.
Exotic pets are the in thing right now.
Short skirts are in again.

meanings.def: to have influence with somebody
all the details, especially the complicated or difficult ones
examples: the ins and outs of the problem
He quickly learned the ins and outs of the job.

meanings.def: something that allows you to join a group of people, an industry, etc. that it is difficult to join, or to understand something that it is difficult to understand

idioms.def: all the details, especially the complicated or difficult ones
examples: the ins and outs of the problem
He quickly learned the ins and outs of the job.

idioms.def: something that allows you to join a group of people, an industry, etc. that it is difficult to join, or to understand something that it is difficult to understand

meanings.def: inch
examples: Height: 6ft 2in.

meanings.def: not; the opposite of
examples: infinite
illogical
immorally
irrelevance

meanings.def: to put into the condition mentioned
examples: inflame
imperil

meanings.def: an activity in which many people take part
examples: a sit-in
a teach-in
